title: Linguistic Analysis-Based Instructional Design for Middle and High School Writing Development

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic sentence structures and grammar, and comprehension of secondary education curricula
context.additional_context: Learner role: students/job seekers, Domain expertise: intermediate, Subject/occupational field: social sciences, Assessment method: project-based evaluation, Technology environment: BYOD (Bring Your Own Device)

learning_goals: Learners can analyze sentence-level linguistic characteristics of middle and high school students' writing and explain developmental stages.
Learners can evaluate real writing samples using linguistic analysis tools and propose improvement strategies.
Learners can design customized teaching strategies considering age-specific differences in writing proficiency.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
